title: [2022.09.2] Finished Blocks Not Updating
body:
## System information | Attribute | Value | | --- | --- | | Erigon Version | `2022.09.2` | | OS | Arch Linux (Linux 5.19.8 `x86_64`) | | Consensus Layer | lighthouse `v3.1.0-aa022f4` | ## Problem When I upgrade to `2022.09.2` early today, I had an issue whereby the Consensus Layer complained that the underlying Execution Layer was always out of date (with a `head is optimistic` error), thereby causing all validations to fail. I could not see anything specific within the logs (see below for logs covering around 5 blocks) that would indicate an issue. When inspecting the metrics though, I did see that the sync status would show the `finished` blocks lagging behind `execution` blocks. The following image shows the behaviour when running `2022.09.1` up until around 9:00, and then 9:00 to 9:43 with `2022.09.2`, and then reverting to `2022.09.1` after 9:43. You can clearly see that in `2022.09.1`, the `finish` and `execution` lines follow each other very closely, whereas when running `2022.09.2`, the `finish` follows the `headers` line instead which I suspect is causing Lighthouse to think Erigon is running behind all the time. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3196162/190881085-d5ee29c4-6103-4dde-a599-658ad6c1e582.png)

Logs

 ``` Sep 18 09:14:12 lighthouse[110821]: INFO New block received root: 0x8c25716c826452387037a59b1be8e8f9543296b8763ea7cbed529e63143fb738, slot: 4719369 Sep 18 09:14:12 erigon[110475]: [INFO] [2/16
